author: rwesten
msg: STANBOL-259: Now independent of the operating systems Unix style '/' are used to normalise configured search paths. Previously File.seperator was used causing the addition of a '\' at the end of configured search paths on Windows. This caused the Bundle.getResource(..) method to fail on providing resources on Windows

msg: Updated release notes for Mime4J 0.7 release

msg: fixed spelling error in introduction, removed attribute "weighted" for storage providers
